00038 #include <string>
00039 #include "Timer.h"
00040 
00041 // Timer Method Definitions
00042 Timer::Timer()
00043 {
00044         #if defined( WIN32 )
00045         // Windows Timer Initialization
00046         QueryPerformanceFrequency( &m_performance_frequency );
00047         m_oneoverfrequency = 1.0/((double)m_performance_frequency.QuadPart);
00048         #endif
00049 
00050         m_time0 = m_elapsed = 0;
00051         m_running = 0;
00052 }
00053 
00054 double Timer::GetTime()
00055 {
00056 
00057 #if defined( WIN32 )
00058         // Windows GetTime
00059         QueryPerformanceCounter( &m_performance_counter );
00060         return (double) m_performance_counter.QuadPart * m_oneoverfrequency;
00061 #else
00062         // UNIX GetTime
00063         gettimeofday( &m_timeofday, NULL );
00064         return m_timeofday.tv_sec + m_timeofday.tv_usec / 1000000.0;
00065 #endif
00066 }
00067 
00068 Timer::~Timer()
00069 {
00070 
00071 }
00072 
00073 void Timer::Start()
00074 {
00075         m_running = 1;
00076     m_time0 = GetTime();
00077 }
00078 
00079 void Timer::Stop()
00080 {
00081         m_running = 0;
00082         m_elapsed += GetTime() - m_time0;
00083 }
00084 
00085 void Timer::Reset()
00086 {
00087         m_running = 0;
00088     m_elapsed = 0;
00089 }
00090 
00091 double Timer::Time()
00092 {
00093         if (m_running)
00094     {
00095         Stop();
00096         Start();
00097     }
00098     return m_elapsed;
00099 }
